str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
Necessary, essential, intimate, right, proper. From anagke; necessary; by implication, close.
From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go forward, go on, advance; I go before, precede. From pro and erchomai; to go onward, precede.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To prepare or complete beforehand. From pro and katartizo; to prepare in advance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Adulation, praise, blessing, gift.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To promise beforehand. Middle voice from pro and epaggello; to promise of old.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
This; he, she, it.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Ready, prepared. From an old noun heteos; adjusted, i.e. Ready.
Adulation, praise, blessing, gift.
And, even, also, namely.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage. From pleonektes; avarice, i.e. fraudulency, extortion.
